page.title: 07ECOLOGY CONTINUED.
page.content: AMONG THESE PLANTS WERE GNATS, LADYBIRDS,BEETLES AND SPIDERS. OUR SECOND SAMPLE WAS AT WHITLEYFORD BRIDGE (03740323). THIS SECTION OF HEDGEROW WAS NEXT TO THE COPSE ALREADY MENTIONED. THE MAIN SHRUBS WERE HAWTHORN, CRACK WILLOW AND SYCAMORE.IN THE BOTTOM OF THE HEDGE WAS A LARGE NUMBER OF NETTLES AND COMMON CLEAVERS. NEARER THE ROAD WAS HEDGE PARSLEY, WHITE AND PINK CAMPION, CHICKWEED, BUTTERCUPS AND DOCK. ONE UNUSUAL PLANT WE FOUND WAS HORSETAIL. BIRDLIFE WE SAW IN THE HEDGE WAS A PHEASANT, A MALE AND FEMALE BLACKBIRD AND SOME SPARROWS. BELOW THE HEDGE WE NOTICED SOME SNAILS, BEES AND CUCKOO SPIT. IN THE BANK WE ALSO SAW TWO HOLES WHICH WERE POSSIBLY THOSE OF SHREWS OR VOLES. WHEN WE DID OUR SURVEY IN JUNE, BANKS AND HEDGEROWS HAD NOT BEEN CUT.
